Am Basteir

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Am Basteir is a vertically-sided blade of rock whose ascent is only possible for keen scramblers from Bealach a Basteir. Below the summit of the mountain is the remarkable lesser peak of the Basteir Tooth - an imposing fang of rock that can only be reached by rock-climbers.

 You have not climbed Am Basteir.

Region: Isle of Skye

Altitude: 934 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 4.38/5
Rating: 4.4/5 (58 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Am Basteir via the Bealach Basteir from Sligachan

Other routes and challenges

The route given up the west ridge from the Bealach Bhasteir is the only one open to scramblers. The link up from the bealach to Sgurr nan Gillean via its west ridge likewise involves graded rockclimbing.
